The symptoms and the palpable nodule in the thyroid lobule raise suspicion of thyroid cancer, specifically medullary thyroid carcinoma due to the patient’s history of neuroblastoma. Fine needle aspiration with cytology is the best next step for diagnosis. Ultrasound examination can be used for further evaluation after diagnosis, and life-long monitoring is necessary for thyroid cancer patients. Thyroid hormone replacement therapy is not indicated at this point and may worsen hyperthyroid symptoms.

Fine needle aspiration with cytology is the most appropriate next step for diagnosis. Ultrasound examination can help to confirm but cannot differentiate between a benign or malignant nodule.
